Scale the combined sketch by a factor of 0.2591. 5. Extrude the first sketch (circle) by 0.1364 towards the positive Z direction (normal). 6. Extrude the second sketch (polygon) by 0.1364 towards the positive Z direction (normal). 7. Combine the two extrusions into a single solid body as the final part. Part 2 Instructions Construct a pyramidal object with a square base and a tapered top. 1. Draw a coordinate system with no rotation at (0.0681, 0.0764, 0). 2. Draw a new face and create a closed loop with the following lines: - Line 1: Start at (0, 0.0532), end at (0.0307, 0) - Line 2: Start at (0.0307, 0), end at (0.0921, 0) - Line 3: Start at (0.0921, 0), end at (0.1228, 0.0532) - Line 4: Start at (0.1228, 0.0532), end at (0.0921, 0.1064) - Line 5: Start at (0.0921, 0.1064), end at (0.0307, 0.1064) - Line 6: Start at (0.0307, 0.1064), end at (0, 0.0532) 3. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.1228. 4. Extrude the sketch by 0.0682 towards the positive Z direction (normal). 5. Subtract the pyramidal object from the cylindrical object (Part 1) to create a hole. Part 3 Instructions Construct a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom. 1. Draw a coordinate system at (0.0614, 0.0614, 0.1364) with no rotation. 2. Create two concentric circles in separate faces, both centered at (0.0682, 0.0682) with a radius of 0.0682. 3. Scale both circles by a factor of 0.1364. 4. Extrude one circle by 0.6136 towards the positive Z direction (normal). 5. Extrude the second circle by 0.6136 towards the negative Z direction (opposite normal). 6. Join both extrusions to create the final part. Please note that some dimensions may have been rounded for readability. Compare the provided values with the original data to ensure accuracy.</description>
